title: Threesome Cellars 2012 Oak Knoll Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Oak Knoll District)
description: This tiny-production wine made by Mark Jessup is tart in green pepper, cedar and clove, with an undercurrent of toasty oak. It persists in herbal characteristics on the finish, with suggestions of currant and sour cherry.

title: Trapiche 2016 Pure Sauvignon Blanc (Uco Valley)
description: Trapiche has never bottled much Sauvignon Blanc, but this one is true to its name: Pure. Easy citrus aromas are mild and clean. This feels medium in body, with a touch of weight. Orange and other dry citrus flavors are steady across the finish.

title: Viniterra 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)
description: Gaseous rubbery aromas are earthy. This feels solid but wiry and angular. Berry, plum, vanilla and mocha flavors finish with a shock of acidity and flavors of chocolate, cherry and cassis.

title: Voliero 2014  Rosso di Montalcino
description: Fresh and easy drinking, this has aromas of violet, wild berry and a whiff of earth. The luminous palate offers tart cherry, clove and a hint of aromatic herb alongside firm acidity and relaxed tannins.

title: Kiona 2015 Late Harvest Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Aromas of jasmine, herb and stone fruit are followed by medium-sweet, lightly spritzy stone fruit and ale flavors.

title: François Lurton 2015 Santa Celina Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Aromas of wet cement, plastic and berry fruits are derivative of heavy oak. This feels as weighty as the nose, but with creaminess. Roasted black-fruit flavors share the stage with campfire and clove, while oak and clove are the dominant flavors on a forceful, heavy finish.

title: Estefania 2015 Tilenus Vendimia Mencía (Bierzo)
description: Wild berry aromas come with notes of Band-Aid and latex. This feels tight and pinched, with hard tannins. A flavor profile built on limited berry and peppery bitterness ends with some clipped tannins.

title: Fulkerson 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Finger Lakes)
description: Barely-there whiffs of mango, guava and orange blossom lend a breathless delicacy to this light-bodied Sauvignon Blanc. It's not deeply concentrated or persistent, but invigorating and quaffable. The finish is brisk and palate cleansing.

title: Zeni 2010 Barriques  (Amarone della Valpolicella)
description: This big bracing red opens with aromas of French oak, coconut and vanilla. Oak sensations dominate the dense assertive palate while astringent tannins leave a raspy finish.

title: Clos de Gat 2015 Chanson Blanc White (Judean Hills)
description: Medium straw in color, this white blend offers the unexpected fragrance of toast and espresso. It is an easy-drinking wine with flavors of apple, lemon curd, peach preserves and toast. Soft floral notes are present on the palate, and the finish is marked by white peach.

title: Clos Teddi 2015 Red (Patrimonio)
description: This ripe, spicy blend of Niellucciu and Grenache has a rich while also fruity character. The tannins are generous, warm and allow the fruit and acidity to express themselves. It will be ready to drink from 2017.

title: Collegiale des Domaines de Loire 2014 Les Bois de Vaux Sec  (Vouvray)
description: This bone-dry wine offers flavors of white fruits. Its crisp acidity is tempered by a touch of honey and spicy almonds. Balanced and fruity, the wine is ready to drink.

title: 14 Hands 2015 The Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Horse Heaven Hills)
description: Reticent aromas of kiwi and herb are followed by tart, medium bodied citrus flavors. The concentration isn't as dense as it could be.

title: Alma de los Andes 2014 Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Grassy and herbal berry aromas suggest beet root. This is gritty and severe on the palate, with bone-dry tannins. Blackened, lightly bitter berry flavors finish with drawing tannins and a charcoal-like burn.

title: Bailly-Lapierre 2015  Saint-Bris
description: This rare intrusion of Sauvignon Blanc into Burgundy is in the small northern vineyard of Saint-Bris, close to Chablis. This wine is fruity with a herbal character that is balanced by the crisp citrus and melon flavors. Drink the wine now.

title: Cambridge & Sunset 2014 California Series Chardonnay (California)
description: This is a good, straightforward table wine with mild fruit flavors, medium body and a touch of vanilla on the finish.

title: Carmel Road 2014 Unoaked Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: The unoaked style is readily apparent on this bottling. Fresh and bright green aromas outdo the more savory ones, conveying Anjou pear, jasmine and light apple cider on the nose. Green apple and more pear show on the palate, with a pithy apple-skin flavor providing tang to the slight acidity.

title: Cave de Lugny 2015 La Côte Blanche  (Mâcon-Villages)
description: This is a soft, gently fruity wine. It comes from a single vineyard creating a wine that has rounded yellow and pear fruits and balanced acidity. It is a smooth wine, made to be drink young.

title: Cave de Saumur NV De Chanceny Rosé Brut Cabernet Franc (Crémant de Loire)
description: This is a soft, light wine with a smoothly creamy texture and wild-strawberry flavors. The aftertaste with bright acidity is refreshing and crisp. Drink now.

title: Bodegas Paniza 2015 Cariñena (Cariñena)
description: Spicy plum and berry aromas are full and fresh. This is Carignan from Cariñena, and it's chunky and lively on the palate with salty rustic leathery berry flavors that fade away on a juicy, tight finish.

title: Bougrier 2015 Domaine Guenault Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)
description: Bright and fruity, this is a crisp, herbal wine. From the Bougrier family estate it is perfumed, creamy and offers refreshing acidity, citrus and hints of apricots. The wine is ready to drink.

title: Domaine Maillard 2011 La Chanière  (Pommard)
description: This wine comes from a village appellation vineyard. With its wood and spice character it is on the lean side. The fruit is behind the dryness, hinting at red plums and dark cherries. It will probably remain a firm wine with a tough aftertaste.

title: Long Meadow Ranch 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Blended with 7% Petit Verdot and 7% Petite Sirah, this velvety and dense wine conveys a pronounced element of charred oak. A reduced note from the barrel permeates at first before allowing aromas and flavors of baked plum to show.

title: Pascal Bouchard 2015 Le Classique  (Chablis)
description: This is Pascal Bouchard's main cuvée of Chablis. It has a soft character: just a touch of spice and crisp sliced apple and green-plum fruitiness. The aftertaste, with its taut minerality, shows the wine is a little young. Drink from 2017.

title: Honig 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Black and inky, this wine offers a plethora of density amongst elements of charred oak, bacon fat and concentrated blackberry jam. Moderate acidity buzzes beneath a richness of serious flavor.

title: Grgich Hills 2013 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: The majority of grapes within this red are grown in Yountville and certified organic. Simple aromatics make way for a touch of reduction on the nose, while flavors of brushy sage, cedar and clove offer more spice than fruit. Sharp tannins lie beneath.

title: Pietranera 2014  Rosso di Montalcino
description: This opens with delicate scents of violet and wild berry. The slender, nervous palate offers suggestions of sour cherry, clove and powdered sage set against bracing acidity. Close-grained tannins leave a drying, rather astringent finish.

title: Martha Clara 2014 Island Series Malbec-Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)
description: While the nose suggests intensely ripe, almost ruddy black plums and cherries, the palate of this full-bodied blend is surprisingly lean. Black fruit flavors, accented by swathes of sage and thyme, are surprisingly crisp and tart. It's a delicately concentrated wine finishing on a meandering fade of soft tannins.

title: Les Vignerons des Terroirs de la Noëlle 2015 Château Juyons Sur Lie  (Muscadet Sèvre et Maine)
description: Vines surround the 18th-century manor house of this estate. This wine is ripe and creamy, softly fruity with touches of acidity and a steely texture that are embedded in the ripe spice and lime flavors. Drink this crisp wine now.
winery: Les Vignerons des Terroirs de la Noëlle

title: Lidio Carraro 2014 Agnus Tannat (Serra Gaúcha)
description: Hot saucy plum and berry aromas set up an abrasive tannic palate that's choppy and short. Dark plum and berry aromas finish with jagged, hard tannins and bright acidity.
